results.title: Renal tubular peptide catabolism in chronic vascular rejection.
results.text_hl: These potentially injurious processes were suppressed by reducing @DISEASE_Proteinuria @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@. Do similar mechanisms of @DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@renal injury@@@ and such a linkage also occur in @DISEASE_Proteinuria @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuric@@@ transplanted @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Vascular_System_Injuries</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D057772 @@@CR@@@, and if so, is @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ then of beneficial value?

citations.NLM: Rustom R, Grime JS, Sells RA, Amara A, Jackson MJ, Shenkin A, Maltby P, Smith L, Hammad A, Brown M, Bone JM. Renal tubular peptide catabolism in chronic vascular rejection. Ren Fail. 2001 May-Jul;23(3-4):517-31. PMID: 11499566
